title: Plural Formation
explanation:
Dutch plural formation follows several patterns. The most common is adding -EN, but there are many exceptions and special cases.

Main patterns:
• Most words: add -EN (de man → de mannen)
• Some words: add -S (de auto → de auto's)
• Special cases: kind → kinderen, stad → steden
• Foreign words: usually add -S (de computer → de computers)

Important rules:
• All plurals use DE as the article
• Words ending in -heid become -heden
• Words ending in vowels get -'s
• Diminutives always add -s

exercises.question: What is the plural of 'het huis' (house)?
exercises.explanation: Huis becomes huizen with vowel change and -EN ending. Remember: all plurals use DE.
exercises.hint: Think about vowel changes and which article plurals use

exercises.question: What is the plural of 'de computer'?
exercises.explanation: Foreign words like 'computer' typically add -S to form the plural.

exercises.question: What is the plural of 'de man' (man)?
exercises.explanation: Man becomes mannen (double n + -EN). This is a common pattern for words ending in a single consonant.

exercises.question: What is the plural of 'de vrijheid' (freedom)?
exercises.explanation: Words ending in -heid become -heden in the plural.
exercises.hint: Words ending in -heid follow a special rule

exercises.question: What is the plural of 'het boek' (book)?
exercises.explanation: Boek becomes boeken with -EN ending. Remember: all plurals use DE.

exercises.question: What is the plural of 'de auto' (car)?
exercises.explanation: Auto becomes auto's with apostrophe + S because it ends in a vowel.

exercises.question: What is the plural of 'het kind' (child)?
exercises.explanation: Kind becomes kinderen (irregular plural). This must be memorized.

exercises.question: What is the plural of 'de mogelijkheid' (possibility)?
exercises.explanation: Words ending in -heid become -heden in the plural.

exercises.question: What is the plural of 'de stad' (city)?
exercises.explanation: Stad becomes steden (irregular plural with vowel change).

exercises.question: What is the plural of 'het meisje' (girl)?
exercises.explanation: Diminutives (ending in -je) always add -s in the plural.

commonMistakes.explanation: All plurals use DE, never HET
Don't just add -S to everything - many words need -EN with vowel changes
Some words have completely irregular plurals that must be memorized
Words ending in vowels need apostrophe + S, not just S

tips: Learn common irregular plurals: kind→kinderen, ei→eieren, blad→bladeren, glas→glazen
Words ending in -HEID always become -HEDEN: vrijheid→vrijheden, mogelijkheid→mogelijkheden
Use apostrophe + S (-'s) for words ending in vowels: auto→auto's, café→café's, taxi→taxi's
Words ending in -je (diminutives) always add -s: meisje→meisjes, boekje→boekjes
When in doubt with Dutch words, try -EN first
Remember: ALL plurals use DE as the article
Foreign words usually add -S: computer→computers, film→films
